author: Ellie lou
title: Blossom ward
body:
My child is a type 1 diabetic and is prone to reoccurring UTIs which cause high ketones and result in severe illness which always results in an admittance to Blossom ward due to how severely sick and lethargic she gets.  
The care in here from all the staff is just absolutely fantastic, they go above and beyond with the patients and the parents. Every admission we have had, we received fantastic care from Blossom ward. Any time I believe something is not right Blossom ward have her in and assess and sort straight away due to how severe ketones can affect them and make them ill so quickly.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Took my Daughter who is 2.5years old. She has never spoke or let a doctor do tests on her. This time however our first time with this doctor and he made her feel so at ease she was telling him the problem and letting him check her. She even got a certificate for been so brave. Now she’s not so scared. What a fab doctor & surgery.

title: Very helpful practice
body: I had a telephone call with the senior nurse practitioner who had found out about preventative treatment for recurrent UTIs. Very helpful and full of understanding carried out her job above and beyond and so helpful

title: Children’s a+e
body: I would like to thank all the staff for the care they gave my grandson yesterday evening. Your care and professionalism was exceptional. Thank you

title: Wonderful experience
body:
I attended this clinic on a Saturday afternoon.  I was greeted by smiling, helpful staff who made me feel valued and comfortable.  I was quickly checked in and saw a doctor almost immediately as they weren’t busy although I believe I was lucky to have arrived during a lull in the day’s appointments.

I could not have asked for better treatment, thank you all.

title: Great  Clinic
body:
Had both cataracts done here ,all staff friendly and helpful 
Pleasant experience and very speedily done 
Very clean modern facility

author: errandsg49
title: Very good diabetic service
body: Very good service, can't thank them enough.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

title: Great Consultation
body: Visited the centre this afternoon after an online consultation with 111. Got an appointment within 2 hours . Receptionist extremely helpful telling us about free car parking and guided us to the waiting area. Appointment was at 2pm but was seeing 5 minutes earlier . The doctor had the best patient empathy I have experienced . Very thorough . Very understanding. Did not feel the consultation was rushed . My only regret is that I did not get his name . Would love to have someone with half his caring attitude at my Practice.  Came away feeling re-assured with a prescription waiting for me at the nominated pharmacy . All in all a 5 star service . Most impressed . Thank you Halton Emergency Care Centre . Many thanks

title: Outstanding
body: I visited Solihull eye clinic today and was treated by everyone with care and compassion.They really were so professional.Congratulations and a thank you from me to you all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Alf19
title: Great care on the maternity ward
body:
We recently gave birth to a beautiful baby boy. Throughout our time within the postnatal ward nothing was too much for the midwives and care assistants.  
I required support during the night so called on a midwife who was more than happy to help me. The next morning I found out that the department was stretched due to staff sickness, yet I was none the wiser due to the time and professionalism of all the midwives and care assistants on that shift and the support they gave me.  
I couldn’t be more thankful at this new and challenging time as a new parent.

title: Awesome practice
body: The practice is the best. This is my first time attending the practice and I am very impressed with the way I was treated and taken good care of. The service provided by the members of staff is great.

title: Excellent care
body: My mum on the 31st March was taken to A&E/Majors by ambulance, the care and support she, myself and brother received from the nurse practitioner on duty was outstanding, can’t thank her enough for realising my mum’s anxiety, she listened to everything we said and acted professionally in getting it sorted quickly and getting my mum discharged. Hopefully mum will get the continued support from her GP she so deserves to continue with a better quality of life. Big thank you to all the District nurses out there who attend mum daily administering insulin as well.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Perfection in all areas.
body: It was my second visit to the Urology Investigation Suite and once again I was treated perfectly by friendly, caring staff who didn’t rush me through, they took the time to ask me about symptoms, explained what was going to happen and gave me the result’s straight after. A really lovely, friendly team. I was really nervous about the procedure but each time they managed to make me feel at ease! Thank you.

title: Treatment of my injury
body:
I fell over on some rough ground & skinned my knee right across peeling back the skin 
Tried to dress it at home but realised I needed someone to help me 
Arrived on a Saturday evening expecting an endless wait, checked in on the iPad system & was triaged quickly. There was a wait to see the injury nurse but she was lovely & cleaned the wound properly & steristripped my knee back together. Thank you for your great service & care

title: Oxfordshire camhs is wholly inadequate
body: My daughter has been in and out of treatment with Child and Adolescent Mental Health Service in Oxford since she was 14. She is now 18. The experience has been so bad that if I had known at the outset how poor the service was, I would have engaged private psychiatric services. The errors and problems are too numerous to list. Examples include, only online meetings where the clinician's understanding of English was so poor that her reports have numerous factual inaccuracies. Multiple conflicting diagnoses that have been given from different clinicians ranging from a personality disorder to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder to anxiety and depression. Having to wait months for therapy despite daughter self harming and presenting at A&E with suicidal ideation. Medicine being promised then prescriptions not being sent. Repeatedly having to chase prescriptions. Meetings with clinicians where notes have clearly not been read and previous diagnoses disputed. Finally she's been dropped by Camhs, into the care of her GP, despite being far from being able to function. Camhs is not fit for purpose and there should be a government enquiry into it.

title: Love the practice
body: A practice that take the time out to contact that their patient as a follow up to medical treatment an introduce them to programs that can further assist them in getting well

title: Amazing service
body: Having rushed into a & e with a painful condition, I cannot thank all the staff enough with how I was treated. I was seen quickly and my treatment/test results/advice given promptly. Please pass on my best wishes to all the staff involved. I am now home and getting some much needed rest!

title: A big thank you to all that treated me.
body:
To the Ambulance staff, pulmonary investigation bay and wards 22 and 32.
Competent and professional treatment, despite the strain of being understaffed, and nearly overwhelmed by cases.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent surgery
body: My appointment was very informative, reassuring, and very good advice. Good face to face time, came away feeling so much more positive. Thank you.

title: Excellent surgery
body: My appointment was very informative, reassuring, and very good advice. Good face to face time, came away feeling so much more positive. Thank you.

author: Ginger4877
title: The staff on this ward are doing a sterling job
body: My mum was admitted to Ward 4B on Friday night, as soon as we arrived on the ward we were made to feel very welcome. On behalf of my mum I would like to express my sincere thanks to Mr Watt, and all the nursing staff especially Staff Nurse Paula who spent time explaining to us as a family what would happen next during a very stressful time. Mr Watt was very empathetic and as a family we appreciated his time. Staff kept my Mum aware at all times what would happen taking the time to go through each procedure, which put my mum at ease. The staff on this ward are doing a sterling job and I just wanted to express my appreciation to them. Thank you.

title: Terrible practice
body: I have been with Vine medical group for about 7 years now and when i first join they would see me for anything i needed and helped in a lot of ways. However the last year has been truly awful and so disappointing. I have a debilitating anxiety disorder that effects my day to day life, i have also suffered with constant physical issues that keep reoccurring and i am completely unable to get help from a GP. I think because of my mental health they dont take me seriously when i call and just chalk absolutely everything i have wrong with me is just my "anxiety" which i think is utterly horrendous. I am left feeling scared and alone during a cery scary time of my life and my symptoms are being ignored. Its completely impossible to get an appointment with them, on the phone or in person. I want help. Serious medical help and they seem to just refuse. Im so dissatisfied and i wish there was a doctor i could just speak to to get the help that i need. Its truly disheartening. Suicide rates are at an all time high and being left alone with no medical help just makes things worse for everyone. Its truly awful. People are scared and in need of help but no doctors or their receptionists seem to care.

author: Ealasaid
title: Positive gynae experience
body:
Originally seen 4.5 years ago. No childbirth and nearly 5 years past menopause. After TVUS, the original consultant, said a biopsy was needed. No further information offered from consultant on procedure or offering to stop if the biopsy was too painful. Traumatic does not describe the event. Unbeknown to me they proceeded to dilate my cervix which resulted in me literally screaming, not a yell, but scream, 3 times, but they carried on, before the Pipelle was used for the biopsy. The biopsy itself was just bearable by using a breathing technique. Couldn't wait to get out of there!!  
Ultimately with no further information, received an appointment to see another consultant. I arrived at said appt and I asked why I was there. The consultant looked at my notes, paused and then said for a Hysteroscopy for a possible polyp. They then asked had I not received any notification from previous appt and I replied I had not. No way was I having this procedure carried out without a GA. I left the appt. and 2 days later received a letter from original consultant saying everything was reassuringly normal and didn't need to be seen again.  
Move on to present day now appx. 10 years past menopause and I was having some vaginal bleeding after bowel movements and a few weeks later was due a smear. Nurse saw polyp protruding from cervix. Within a very short time was seen by a Dr who was assisted by nurse at Stobhill. What a difference. Everything was explained and I agreed to them trying to remove the polyp . No entry into the cervix was required at this time. I was reassured that they would stop any time I asked. This was successful with a bit of discomfort but not unbearable.A hysteroscopy was recommended and I agreed provided it was under GA. They explained, then listened and did not dismiss my concerns, and no undue pressure to agree to IUD after I had carried out my own research. Again all appts were very quickly arranged. So far, the outcome is looking very favourable and a very caring Dr. has restored some of my faith in the medical profession. So a huge thank you to the doctor and the staff involved at theatre, recovery and Ward 56 at the Glasgow Royal Infirmary.Would certainly recommend this doctor as a Gynae Consultant!

title: Excellent surgery
body:
My recent face to face consultation was very thorough, informative and helpful. All my experiences with the surgery have been positive
including access by phone which has only ever meant a short wait in the queue before being able to speak to a helpful member of the reception team.

author: Beryl B
title: I am so grateful for everything you did for me
body:
I attended J25 (Ophthalmology) St James Hospital in Leeds today for day surgery. I want to commended the medical and nursing staff who treated and looked after me. I was nervous about this appointment, being 82 years young (!), but felt so reassured by the teams professionalism, compassion, care and good humour! One doctor was so kind as to place a pillow under my legs as my back was hurting, this really helped me and was a distraction from the procedure l had done.  
I am so grateful for everything you did for me and feel you need recognition for it.

title: Well done, Global Clinic Norwich
body: Very efficient & caring staff. Good experience. Would recommend. Not hurried along. Not kept waiting at all.

title: New practice
body: I was unsure how the take over of a different company would affect the practice, but when I needed a appointment I got one fairly quickly and was very happy with how I was treated, the doctor who I hadn't seen before was very thorough

title: Excellent
body: Excellent and professional attitude displayed with me on the day. Ongoing reminders of my appointment to ensure I am updated as well as the additional letter in the post. The service I received on the day was courteous and respectful. I had an MRI and the site was clean, sanitised and clearly signposted.

author: robinze47
title: Thank you again for taking such good care of us
body:
At the end of January I went into labour and our little girl was born in Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy. My care from the midwives and consultants from moment I entered the hospital to the moment we left was excellent. Despite it being one of the busiest days for deliveries in the maternity unit, I felt that myself, my newborn daughter and my husband were very well looked after and did not know this until the January statistics were posted.  
Some special recognition should go to Zara who was with us throughout our delivery and after care and Lynn who was part of my post surgery care, these two amazing ladies truly made me in awe of the NHS and the service they provide for us. Thank you again for taking such good care of us and helping me bring my daughter into the world we will forever be grateful.

author: syste-matic
title: Very poor communication and hospital hygiene
body:
I visited paediatric A&E in WHH with my son due to his high blood pressure. Firstly we went to pediatric A&E and they have done all basic tests and then we were sent to see GP out of hours. The GP sent us back to pediatric A&E due to concerns my son had high blood pressure. Already there was very poor communication between out of hours GP and paediatric A&E as no results or communication passed between each other in a timely way. The waiting rooms are ever so filthy. I am a communist child and the hospitals in Easter Europe are cleaner then in WHH.  
Then we were taken Blood tests and sent to x-ray and told to go home and then if no one calls us to then call Padua ward and ask for the results and another blood pressure test would be done. 48 hours since we first came home and no one has bothered to communicate.  
I rang Padua ward twice and the second time I found the nurse quite rude, asking why I am calling and continuously interrupted the conversation rather than listening. If they are a professional then they should be compassionate and sound professionally. They sounded very fed up.  
I am working within social service and we are all busy but maintain my professionalism at all times. If this nurse feels fed up with her profession then they should leave. I will think 10 times before visiting this hospital. It feels that want they want people to go somewhere else and not being bothered. This hospital is like 100 years behind the ape age.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely local practice
body: This Practice is fantastic!  A little 'gem', hidden away in Sutton Benger.  Doctors are brilliant and it's great to have the pharmacy in the Surgery too, so convenient!  This is what all GP Practices should be like - staff are friendly, the Surgery is conveniently located for us and we are always seen quickly when we need an appointment - what else can I say - we are very lucky to have this in our village!

author: Mully
title: A Cataract and Cornea Assessment.
body:
Quite fearful and confused, I was dropped off at Falmouth Health Centre. My first visit meant I had no idea were to go and was struggling to see on a bright and sunny day.  
I got in and wandered a little aimlessly until I saw somebody. She turned out to be the nurse who would be assessing me with another nurse. Kathy chatted as she lead me to a seat and explained what would be done. I was only left a few minutes before they lead me into the assessment room.  
Kathy and Karen could not have been more professional or more caring, but did the whole assessment with great good humour as well.  
Once the assessment was over they were happy to listen to any of my questions and really addressed my main concerns over the actual operation I would need.  
I have a very real fear of my eyes being touched and had a very confused idea of what would take place. That confusion was laid to rest very quickly as they showed me how very easy and painless any work on the eye could be.  
With both humour and professional knowledge they quickly boosted my confidence in the procedure's I would be having. I was even given a practical example which was a major relief to me.  
Their helpfulness and kindness will stay with me for many years to come.  
Likewise, my visit a few minutes later to Mr Muhammed who was the Assistant Specialist Ophthalmologist was enlightening and encouraging.  
Using language I would understand, he explained clearly what would have to be done and the reasons behind it.  
At all times I was treated with great courtesy and as an individual. All three made me feel like I was important to them. It may only be an impression... but it meant the world to me while feeling so nervous.

author: Daire
title: Many thanks for the kindness
body:
With a Covid outbreak no visiting has been possible. However, the video call with my mum who has been very ill made such a difference to us both.  
Many thanks for the kindness and everything was handled with great sensitivity.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great service- A and E
body: I attended the A&E dept today - I found all of the staff I encountered to be totally amazing. Special thanks go to the lovely Dr who dealt with me. He was friendly professional and concise with relevant information and I felt completely at ease at all times. Also a mention for the chap in the XRay Dept who was a complete ray of sunshine. I know that patients can be quick to complain about wait times etc but I just saw an efficient team working hard. Well done to all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

author: novemberxj79
title: Waiting in accident and emergency
body:
I called NHS 24 after suffering a fall downstairs 2 days ago. I have severe (very dark purple) bruising on my hip which is swollen and hard. It has begun tracking down my leg and very painful.  
I was told to go to A&E immediately. I attended Vic hospital and checked in at 16:30. In a lot of pain. Lower back hip pelvis area. I have been triaged but am still waiting 3 hours later.  
I feel this is an absolute disgrace.

title: Receptionist Staff
body:
I was recently attending for an appointment with my GP... While sitting waiting I was becoming very annoyed with other patients and the inappropriate comments they were using towards the reception staff. 
I feel that these girls go above and beyond to accommodate all patients in a respectful manner.
 Always  very pleasant helpful and respectful.

title: Well organised and friendly staff
body:
I've visited the Physio Dept quite a few times now and I've never been kept waiting for very long every time. The staff are warm and friendly, certainly know what they are doing and keep you well informed on your treatment.
The one small criticism is that the treatment area is a little impersonal as you can hear other patients' conversations.

title: Cannot fault the delivery suit and post natal ward
body:
Recently had my baby at Worthing hospital and I also needed to be readmitted to the post natal ward
Every member of staff was absolutely super. Great communication and such caring people I am so grateful for the high level of care they provided to me and my baby

author: CVW30
title: A wonderful service and truly brilliant team.
body:
I was seen in colposcopy clinic today by consultant Harper and a nurse called Jen and a HCA called Ania.  
The care I received was fantastic. Everyone was so caring and made me feel very comfortable.  
I cannot praise this team enough. Dr Harper explained everything perfectly and kept me well informed.  
Nurse Jen and Ania spoke to me the whole time and were just so professional and retained my dignity at every aspect.  
Please please pass on this massive compliment to them all and send them all a huge thank you from me  
A wonderful service and truly brilliant team.

title: Relaxed
body: Only went for a scan but everything from parking. Bilking in and being seen was so easy any straightforward . Made it a relaxing experience instead of rushing about like other places . Was in an out in 25 mins . Thanks again

title: Exceptional staff
body: I can't praise the nursing staff and doctor highly enough. My son was quickly seen and assessed and medication started within 2 hrs of arriving. He had quinsy and we were referred straight over to the ENT team at the Freeman where quality care continued. A potentially scary situation where his throat was narrowing all brought under control within 5 hrs of arriving. Thank you all so much for your food humour, care and efficiency.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The care we received was quick and effective
body:
When my 5-year-old son had breathing difficulties, we had to bring him to the Blossom Paeds OPD at Craigavon. From the moment we arrived this morning, we were impressed by the professional, efficient, and thoughtful care we received. The triage process was quick, and the triage nurse clearly kept our son's needs in mind. The doctor and nurse on duty were very child-friendly and got right to work. Thanks to their treatment, my son's condition improved significantly.  
The leaflet on croup provided us with further advice, which was easy to understand and very helpful. We are grateful to all the staff involved in our son's care, and we had a great experience at the department. The care we received was quick and effective, which is exactly what we needed. We found all the staff we encountered to be very friendly, and there was a nice atmosphere in the department.  
Thank you to everyone who played a part in our son's care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Finance Guy who is now watching Blue Lights!
title: Amazing service
body:
I have broken my elbow and attended Monklands today. I phoned 111 and asked for advice and was told to attend A&E at at 9am.  
The reception staff were extremely friendly, one called Lesley. Very welcoming & made me feel at ease. I was then taken for an X-Ray with Gaynor. She was amazing. So friendly, made me comfortable, had a good chat with her (currently watching the recommended TV show - so far so good!). I was then saw in the plaster room with Diane & James - again made me feel at ease & had a good chat and laugh whilst providing all relevant information.  
I went back round to Gaynor and we finished up my care.  
Amazing service & would’ve struggled without the minor injuries at Monklands.

author: AH62
title: Kind, caring and reassuring staff
body: I attended WGH minor injuries clinic one evening at the beginning of March 2023 with a broken wrist. I was taken immediately and all the staff who dealt with me - receptionist, practitioners, x ray, plaster technician- throughout were lovely. They were kind, caring and reassuring. Well done and thank you all.

title: Welcoming and caring staff
body:
True reflection of high quality care. 

Seen within 1.5hrs of calling 111. GP was very caring & assessed my daughter quickly. She had a lovely way with my daughter. Very pleased to have seen her today and a true credit to the nhs.

title: Feeling safe with Claughton Medical Centre
body:
Always very happy with the excellent care and attention from all the staff in Claughton Medical Centre.I am always seen and sorted quickly which gives me great security with my health .Very well organised and pleasant reception staff as well as highly competent and friendly doctors.
Thank you

author: Madone
title: Staff provided excellent aftercare
body: Rang and was given an apt for same day, staff worked around time that suited me. Very prompt in triaging and follow up tests. Excellent communication and attentiveness from all different staff, thorough in trying to find answers and staff provided excellent aftercare and listening skills

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent
body: Quick service - wasn’t on hold for long (place in queue was made clear while waiting). Telephone appointment on the same day. Prescription sent and collected on same day. Great service overall

author: Ladyof leisure
title: Appointment at Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy
body: Was at Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy, Urology Dept for a Flexible Cystoscopy All staff were very helpful and very pleasant and I couldn't fault them in any way.

title: Excellent service
body: My dad was taken in as an emergency and the staff were amazing from the very start until we collected him on the Sunday afternoon. All the staff involved were professional and were faultless in their treatment of my dad. A big thank you to all.

author: LC83
title: Kind and caring health visitor
body:
Providing feedback on health visitor Gayle from Taybank Medical Centre Dundee. She's been a fantastic source of support for me! Meeting me before birth of my child at request of midwife, as I was suffering few depression, and supporting me throughout those very early days, weeks and months, giving advice and sitting with me to make sure I had someone. She was always available and so kind and caring.  
I can't rate her highly enough!

author: piscesrm88
title: Wonderful energetic nurse in A&E
body: My elderly father was brought to A&E and after a short wait was seen by a very energetic advanced nurse Lisa. Just wanted to express my thanks of how wonderful she was towards dad - she even got him some orange juice despite everyone being ran off their feet. Many thanks to the whole team.

title: Excellent service
body:
To all the doctors and staff who helped with my accident, a big thank you for your excellent support and treatment. 
Could not have asked for more. 
Thanks!!

author: oscarxs93
title: This is an invaluable service to our community.
body: The team came to treat my elderly father whom has multiple health issues. They were able to administer his antibiotic, fluids and complete blood tests without the stress of him having to go to hospital. We cannot thank this team enough, not only did they treat my father professionally but they went above and beyond and offered personal care which helped the family immensely. They also comforted the family especially his elderly wife. When they completed my father’s treatment, we were assured that they were just a phone call away if we needed anything. I cannot recommend this service highly enough. This is an invaluable service to our community.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Safe ward
body: I have been on this ward for a few days at the start of the week I was in the trauma ward. When I first entered the orthopedic ward the staff were welcoming and all introduced themselves, I have felt very safe on this ward. The communication is very good, I have been informed by nurses and doctors regularly and there easy to get a hold of if I have any questions. The staff are also really friendly which has made it a lot easier.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent
body: Excellent staff, they put me at ease as I was very nervous, nothing was too much trouble for them. I was explained everything from what was going to happen and what I should do at home.the ward infact the whole hospital was clean. Excellent couldn't fault my stay their.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

author: AlisonS73
title: Friendly medical team
body:
I had an appointment at Dr Raj’s Clinic in University Hospital Wishaw. The reason I was referred was due to heavy periods. I am in my fifties and peri menopausal.  
My appointment letter explained the procedures that would be carried out and I must admit was apprehensive due to the ‘fear of the unknown’ especially when it advised to take paracetamol an hour before my appointment.  
I was taken in less than 5 minutes upon my arrival at the clinic. Dr Raj then explained what would happen during the examination. This consisted of an internal scan, internal camera examining my womb and fallopian tubes and a sample of my womb lining being taken for further testing. Dr Raj and the nurses present were very friendly and did relax me answering all my questions.  
The internal scan was like a smear test and very straightforward. Dr Raj inserted numbing lotion or cream and told me if I felt it too uncomfortable I could have a local anaesthetic. When the camera was inserted it was fine until it reached my fallopian tubes. This caused me discomfort however not severe enough to warrant a local anaesthetic. When it came to the section of womb lining being taken, this was over with very quickly, again with slight discomfort. While the examination was being carried out the nurses and Dr Raj continually asked me if I felt ok. I could also have had a coil inserted at the same time to help with my heavy periods, although for unrelated personal reasons I declined. Personally I was glad it was all carried out at the same time and I didn’t have to keep going back to have the procedures done separately.  
Afterwards I felt a bit tender when bending over but no pain so didn’t take any painkillers. The next morning I was back to my normal self with no pain or discomfort at all.  
If you are referred to Dr Raj’s clinic in University Hospital Wishaw, don’t hesitate to go. The medical team are great and as I said earlier having it all done and dusted during one appointment is a fantastic resource to the community.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great relationship between staff
body: I have had a good stay at Lurgan. The staff have been perfect. I could not have asked for better care. I think its awful how overworked and underpaid the nurses are! The staff all work so well together and you can really see they all have a great relationship.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not enough variety at meal times
body: The staff are unbelievable, they have been so attentive and caring. The food isn't the best, but I wasn't expecting a lot anyway. Although I would say there could definitely be a better range to chose from on the menu. Often enough I am stuck on what to have as there isn't a lot of variety. I don't mind breakfast as I usually just have toast and a cup of tea or porridge, which is what I would usually have in the house anyway.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cristinavc23
title: Admission for knee replacement
body:
My mum received after a long time a slot for her knee replacement. Unfortunately the orthopaedics team done a mistake and she was sent to a different hospital to have her surgery. We waited and when assessment day came told us that we need to come back to Broomfield Hospital for the operation.  
At the time of writing we are waiting in front of John Ray ward for a bed to be admitted. We have been waiting for over 9 hours and the only explanation was that they had patients coming overnight and that’s why my mum has had to wait. I am worried that management is in need of some help to manage these issues. If the patient has to wait this long, at least provide something more comfortable to wait as the plastic chairs outside are very uncomfortable for elderly.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: Warrior29
title: Expert neuro team
body: I recently stayed in the DCN ward 130, after my craniotomy. I want to express my gratitude to all the staff for my care, in particular a huge shout out to my theatre nurse Josh, and ward nurses Alanis and Jo. I had a particularly tough first night but this was made better by the nurses who all worked incredibly hard. Thank you to the whole neuro team and my Neuro consultant for your expertise, time and support.

author: andromeda37
title: Refused treatment
body:
I had to use the NHS 24 service for my 6 week old son on a Saturday night- 20 minute wait to speak to a call handler called Laura who was wonderful. Very helpful and friendly who helped direct us to the out of hours service.  
I then received a phone call from someone at the Douglas Street clinic and was told that they had reached capacity and were not reviewing or receiving any more patients tonight or overnight. When I explained my son was 6 weeks old and all I felt he needed was a certain medication, I was told he would have to wait to speak to a GP on Monday or take him to A&E. I didn't feel it required A&E but I was left no other choice as it couldn't wait another 48 hours to potentially wait for a GP appointment.  
We attended Monklands A&E where he was treated and discharged after 4 hours. The staff were lovely and very clearly were busy and under pressure with other families and patients who were put in the same position as us.  
I appreciate the pressures on the health service at the minute, but to refuse treatment of a 6 week old baby, who I'm actively trying to keep out of hospital as I understand the pressures currently is when you truly know the system is broken.

author: corvussy69
title: The best of care from the best of people
body:
I was in Ward 6 for almost 5 weeks. To name individuals would be remiss of me as I'm sure I would miss someone out who ought to be included. May I just say I had the best of care from the best of people, Forever you will have my gratitude and respect.  
Thank You All  
[Very happy with 'Environment']

author: Stuart8745
title: My recent experience and hospital admission
body: I feel I was very distressed.  I had to wait approx 11 hours in A&E, which was rammed full of patients. I was finally admitted and was taken to an assessment ward. This ward was noisy, chaotic and was late at night so I got no rest. In the early hours I was moved to another ward, 8b Stroke Ward. This ward was also chaotic, loud which limited me any sleep or rest. During my 5 day admission, my Endoscopy procedure was delayed by more than a day because the Dept was closed. On the final day, the day of discharge, I was told at noon that I could leave but that Pharmacy would supply medication.  I asked whether I needed to wait because I already had said medication.  I was told this was different medication.  I waited more than 4 hours, regularly chasing up my discharge TTO's.  At 4.15 I chased up the medication again as I wanted to leave, but was told there was no medication for me other than what I already had. I was furious that I had been kept there more than 4 hours for something I already had.

author: aa444
title: I broke my tooth
body:
Ive not been to the dentist since 2017 and I broken my tooth, I was given an emergency appointment at the Glasgow emergency dentist and the experience was excellent. From the lovely Spanish receptionist Maria who was super helpful to the Dentist and her assistant, thank you so much for fixing my tooth and making it pain free.  
You were all very reassuring. I really can't see any room for improvements.

author: hydrusdp66
title: Being listened to and my experiences being validated.
body:
I have had Long Covid since October 2020 and have struggled to manage the effects of this (mainly chronic fatigue) over the last couple of years. It has been particularly difficult to maintain sustained periods of attendance at my job and engage in day to day activities  
In Sep 2022 I was referred to the Long Covid Rehab Team in NHS Lanarkshire after requesting this from my GP surgery. I have recently had my final appointments with the team, although there is a three-month period where I can get back in touch if needed without being re-referred which is really helpful.I saw David (Respiratory Physio), Dr Kapsali (Psychologist) and briefly Pamela (Occupational Therapist) and their support and advice has been an important part of my recovery. I am not 100% recovered however my quality of life and mental health has significantly improved over the last few months due to support from the team as well as leaving my job to focus on recovery. This has enabled me to live a life mostly without experiencing symptoms of post-exertional-malaise, to engage in the activities that are important to me and slowly re-build my life in a more sustainable way.The clinical advice was, of course, incredibly helpful but I also really valued being listened to and my experiences being validated. This has been especially important as, out-with this team, there have been times when I have felt my experiences have been dismissed or misunderstood.

author: april8499
title: We can’t speak more highly of their care
body: We would like to thank crew members Richard and Tim for their care of my Nanny recently. They showed compassion and communicated clearly with us as family, their decision making skills that morning meant that my Nanny was rushed to AAH were they were able to provide further treatment. We can’t speak more highly of their care and without it my Nanny would not be back home with us.

author: Charlie62
title: Can’t thank them enough
body: Excellent care across the board. Took time to make sure I knew what to expect and that I was comfortable throughout. Can’t thank them enough for the difference they have made for me.

author: SuzyQ
title: Relieving any worries my mum had.
body:
My 87 year old mother had a fall outside while, luckily landing on grass. However, it became apparent that she had broken or dislocated her pinky. We immediately took her up to our local A&E around 10am, our first time attending here. The staff and service was amazing. Every member of staff throughout her process was lovely and friendly and reassuring to my mum, not making her feel old or silly at any point.  
Of particular note is Wendy, Emergency Nurse Practitioner, who was amazingly kind with my mum, explaining everything as she went, and relieving any worries my mum had.  
Unfortunately my mum's finger could not be manipulated back into the socket so she required a plaster which Wendy fitted there and then, taking the utmost care with my mum. We left with an appointment for orthopaedics in a couple of weeks, which was also amazing. We were in and out within an hour, such a good experience after all the bad reports everyone hears.

author: Vanrg56
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: They are a delight
body: The two ladies who came here were very cheerful and certainly made Ken feel very much better in himself. In fact I hadn't heard him laugh like that for some time. They are a delight.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Ayla22
title: SCBU Staff - Angels in Disguise
body:
Our twins were born premature at 31 weeks in CAH, due to the quick actions of the medical staff they both arrived safely. I cannot thank this wonderful team enough and the nurses in ICU/neonatal who cared for our girls and us for 4 weeks.  
We were transferred to DHH SCBU for a further 4 weeks and whilst initially we were anxious about the move we were quickly reassured.  
Anna-marie and Mary met us that first evening and I knew straight away our girls would be so well cared for.  
We had a long journey of 9 weeks in hospital but I cannot begin to thank the staff of DHH SCBU enough for everything they done for our twins and us as parents.  
The unit was extremely busy and over capacity on occasion yet these nurses had a smile on their face and made time to check in on us, answer all of our questions and care for the babies as if they were their own.  
I have never met a team of people who honestly go above and beyond their job role to make sure that the babies are safe and well looked after and that families are well supported.  
It was honestly the scariest experience of our lives as one of our twins was quite unwell from birth and we were naturally anxious about how she would present when she was discharged.  
We need not have worried as the medical and nursing staff ensured we knew how to recognise if there was a deterioration and what to do in the event - they dealt with everything so calmly which certainly rubbed off on us.  
There are so many to mention but these staff truly deserve more than thanks for what they do each and every day. It is very clearly more than a job to this team and they often worked past their hours, sacrificing their own family lives to care for other families.  
From the bottom of our hearts Thank you to Anna-marie, Mary, Niamh, Tracy, Clare, Claire, Vicky, Geraldine, Audrey, Lissy, Sinead and Fionnaula.  
And a very special word of thanks to Sister Ann who met us on the first week, introduced herself and from that moment on she radiated positivity and amazing advice to us as anxious parents. Her skills, experience, warmth and empathy was so natural and she was always there to help out and making sure the babies, families and staff were taken care of.  
The unit was so warm and friendly and the staff could not have done enough for us. I often said how much I would love to go back and work there. And that is testament to the amazing ward sister and staff. They truly are a credit to the SHSCT.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: giraffegn58
title: We are particularly humbled
body:
I’m writing this on behalf of my partner who visited the Minor Injuries unit based within A&E FVRH last night. We are really amazed and grateful for the care we received. My partner was checked in, triaged, x-rayed, reviewed and discharged all within 45 mins. Really impressed with the speedy service given the challenges we could see going on around us.  
We are particularly humbled by a male nurse who was treating another patient in the waiting area. He apologised to her for her lengthy waits and expressed that this is not the way he would wish to care for her given the wait times, lack of patient care areas and number of patients waiting to be seen. He thanked her for her patience and did everything he could to reassure and apologies to her. The staff are doing an amazing job under incredible pressure, which is not appreciated enough.

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: I am very appreciative of the care given
body:
Comment received from family member of female patient from Derry/Londonderry are.  
My mother who has Alzheimer's was extremely well looked after. I am very appreciative of the care given and kindness shown to my mother.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Danny234
title: Due to his mental health he should have had counselling
body:
My brother was admitted to Queen Elizabeth University Hospital at the end of December 2022. In early January 2023 he had an amputation to above his knee. A few weeks later I was informed that rehab was not progressing and due to the level of care he needed he would need to go into a care home. My brother was informed of this.  
Throughout his 3 weeks I was told he was in low mood, withdrawn, I asked if he could be given a little more time but this was not an option. A couple of days later, I was informed that my brother was now refusing food, drink and medication. I visited him but he passed away very soon after.  
I feel that due to his mental health he should have had counselling and when informed about the care home I should have been present. He obviously decided to end his life as to him it wasn't worth living. I thought hospitals considered mental health as well as the physical side and feel he was let down. I am still in shock at having lost my brother in such a way. I can only consider this suicide, as he really took his own life.  
The nurse in the ICU was very helpful and caring as was the nurse in ward 11a.  
I feel a counsellor could have spent time with him to see why he was in a bad place mentally to consider ending his life in this way. Also perhaps it can take longer than 3 weeks for someone who is trying to cope with the shock of losing his leg.

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

author: Welsh
title: She is a very helpful and lovely health visitor
body:
Sabrina did my son’s assessment, the appointment went really well , Sabrina give me loads of information about different services I can reach to help my son with his needs, she is very helpful and lovely health visitor  
She is there when I need help or information to help my son or myself

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ckhing76
title: Thank you to all involved. Absolutely angels.
body:
I was quite anxious about the appointment but Maria met me with a friendly smile and I felt better. She introduced me to Lee that would be carrying out my procedure and she couldn’t have been more caring, understanding and helpful in answering all my questions.  
During the procedure I was put at ease by all the ladies in the room but Maria was particularly good at distracting me and comforting me once I’d received the good news.  
Thank you to all involved. Absolutely angels.

author: ararp67
title: The inclusion team/recovery service are 10 out of 10
body:
Since arriving in prison in Dec 2010 I didn't receive much support with my substance misuse issues. I found this to be the case prison to prison. Since arriving at Wakefield the inclusion team/recovery service has given me ample support and guidance over the past 5 and a half years. The whole team are very knowledgeable regarding all subjects relating to recovery (drug and alcohol).  
I have worked on the issues and overcame my addiction and now i'm at a stage where I have become a recovery champion to assist others who are at the start of their recovery journey and to offer support and guidance to anyone who is struggling and wants advice pr support. The inclusion team/recovery service here at HMP Wakefield are running a professional service and are 10 out of 10.

author: mikems85
title: It made me feel like I actually mattered.
body: The recovery service has been invaluable to me. Always there to help when no one else could or would. It made me feel like I actually mattered if they had more investment they could help more people and spend more time with those they are always helping.

author: nitratezz47
title: Grateful for attention
body: Had interview with One Step.   The staff were so helpful and covered every aspect of the health examination.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hippoen45
title: I feel like a new person
body: The recovery service has been a big and important role in my journey and I dread to think where I would be without them, with there support and feel like a new person and have realised what help I did need they have been there for me good times and the hard and have also worked better than the mental health team. Her support is without question what is needed in a prison environment.

author: delphinuseq59
title: The staff are very supportive and very approachable.
body: Very positive. The staff are very supportive and very approachable.

author: Hugh325
title: Dermatology department
body: I had an appointment, when I arrived I was told I had cancelled my appointment which I most definitely didn’t as in urgent need of it. I was told by the receptionist I couldn’t be seen. I have been given another appointment which I feel is way too long. Can someone please help me?After suffering with feet like this for months I am very upset, I’ve left the department in tears and deeply frustrated I was unable to be seen

author: scorecardbf44
title: Day surgery treatment
body: I was in Day Surgery University Hospital Wishaw for surgery and all the nurses, doctor, anaesthetist, theatre staff were absolutely amazing and put me at ease.

author: we1980
title: Substance misuse workers in prison spread thin
body:
I am the recovery champion  
So I see first hand a lot of the issues. The substance misuse workers are spread thin. (there needs to be more)  
The prison officers are not knowledgeable, the new ones know the bare minimum.  
The wing staff are changed from one wing to another day to day so things being looked into one day cannot be continued the next. Should the issue not have been resolved with the officers shift.  
The courses that are available are not advertised around the wing enough so people dont know whats around as an option!  
I hope this helps

author: AzulBlue
title: Me and newborn son
body:
I went into labour at 36 weeks, so the expected plan of nice structured, planned birth didn't happen unfortunately.  
I was very stressed, in pain and panicking, however the staff at Crosshouse were absolutely fantastic in calming me down significantly in the first instance- in particular initial midwife Lisa who was with me for the majority of time while operating theatre was prepared, and also her colleague who then joined her Ann-Marie. Both were epitome of midwifery professionalism and excellence.  
I can only apologise I cannot remember the names of the theatre staff who carried out the section, as they all deserve praise too.  
Once on the ward to recover, I'd like to acknowledge the care support from all staff, but in particular Laura, Victoria and Louise.  
All of the staff from Crosshouse were excellent which should be recognised in these still difficult times.

author: Horsham mum
title: Great care for my son
body:
My young son managed to get washing detergent in both eyes yesterday. After calling 111 (and receiving great care there) I was told to go to A&E to check all is ok. We waited a short period of time (10-15 mins) when my son was treated by two lovely nurses. Thankfully there was only minor damage to my son's eyes and we were gone with medication in 1 hour.  
Amazing, speedy care considering it was 10:00-11:00pm on a Saturday night. Both nurses were lovely to my son and made him feel at ease (he even received a teddy which he was delighted about). The next morning the eye doctor called me and recommended we come to East Surrey to check all is ok. We were told to come two hours later. The doctor throughly checked my sons’ eyes and scanned them and all was fine.  
Great care from East Surrey!

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust
South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: JZE25
title: Excellent care by all the staff
body:
I would like to thank Miss Leitch, the consultant colorectal surgeon, and all the staff - (Lynn, Gail, Narveen - that looked after me so well in the endoscopy unit at the new Stobhill hospital.  
The unit was clean and the care was exemplary.

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: dancefy83
title: Amazing health visitor
body: My current health visitor Sabrina has been amazing since she came to us. She's always there to help at the drop of a hat and has went above and beyond in supporting me and my son. Have not had a better experience from she came on board. Amazing at what she does.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Andqc73
title: Attentive and helpful staff in A&E
body:
My Mother attended Hairmyres Hospital as she experienced issues with her breathing, chest pains and sore arm on at the end of March at approximately 3:00 am.  
On arrival my Mother was taken by a lovely nurse Caroline to start the triage process. Caroline's approach to the support she offered my Mother made her feel a lot more at ease and talked my Mother through all the processes and tests which she was undertaking.  
Nurse Caroline continued to support my Mother from A&E triage through to be supported by the other Nurses within the A&E department.  
Nurse Flecture and Nurse Hannah were extremely attentive with my Mother and again talked her through all the processes, tasks and tests which were being undertaken. The Nurses allowed me to remain with my Mother through the majority of the process within A&E and only asked me to wait within another area to ensure my Mothers dignity was intact when undertaking observations.  
The A&E department as it potentially is most was nights was extremely busy with others requiring support. I think its important to highlight though this was the case my Mother was not rushed and was made to feel at ease, comfortable can have confidence within the Hospital.  
I'm happy to advise my Mother is now Home after spending 11 nights in Hairmyres Hospital, has cleared her infection and now on course of medication which should sustain her independence with living at home.  
Thank you to all the staff who work within the Hospital as I'm sure there will be more NHS staff who contributed to my Mothers A&E experience.

author: Adoxap
title: Outpatient removal of rodent ulcer from face
body: I can’t fault the treatment I received from the doctor and nurse . Both were so kind and efficient and amazingly I had no pain during or after the procedure.

author: Alfara2023
title: Comfortable and supported throughout
body: We have a great relationship with our health visitor and also have great sessions of baby massage with another professional. They both make us feel comfortable and supported throughout our journey with our baby!

author: festivityyp77
title: Made me feel more comfortable
body: When I went to physio all the staff were super kind and supporting, it made me feel more comfortable being there.

author: CNSW64
title: Gynaecology Ward 49 Qeen Elizabeth Hospital
body:
I received gynaecological surgery and was admitted to ward 49 Queen Elizabeth Hospital for post operative care.  
The ward was very clean and well organised. The staff were amazing, each and everyone including the domestic staff. The nurses were do kind, empathetic and informative. They were so busy but never made you feel uncomfortable or worried, they really were so friendly and professional.

author: Dawlish 21
title: The care of an elderly relative
body:
I brought my COVID positive, elderly mother to A & E at the Queen's Medical Centre.  
Her Oxygen levels were dangerously low and within minutes they were treating her. We were very appreciative of the kindness and consideration of all the staff involved.  
As she had COVID she was put in the Isolation ED which was not so hectic and noisy as elsewhere - this is so important. She was monitored and looked after very well. Luckily the staffing levels were good.  
We wanted to thank all the Isolation ED staff very much.

author: giftmc37
title: Wonderful dermatology staff
body: I was delighted when I went for my appointment, all the staff there were very wonderful. I left feeling very pleased

author: soilcs65
title: Reassuring nurse
body: I was very impressed when the specialist stroke nurse came out to see me. She allayed all my fears, told me all about my medication and gave me time to ask lots of questions. Everything I asked was answered and I honestly feel much better and on the mend. Thank you Marion for your reassurance you were very informative.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: Andqc73
title: Support and confidence in the NHS
body:
My Mother was admitted to Ward 12 at Hairmyres Hospital on Wednesday 22nd March 2023 due to ongoing respiratory issues & lung infection.  
I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the Nurses who took time to ensure my Mother was comfortable, had access to her nebuliser and attended to her when she required support, drinks and at times just to offer reassurance.  
I would like to extend my thanks to all the staff though two Nurses in particular - Nurse Fiona and Nurse Nicole who supported my Mother and both my Sister and I with providing updates in terms of treatment, availability and updates from the Doctors/Consultant and providing a confidence with my Mother that made her feel at ease within the Ward.  
Without Nursing staff that provide this level of attentive care our NHS would not be held in as high regards.  
My Mother is now Home after period of 11 nights in Hairmyres. She has received appropriate treatment, medications and ongoing support. Hopefully through time she will be able to remain at home with medication plan and live her life as independent as possible!  
Thanks again for the support and confidence we have in the NHS! :)

title: Recommend Practice
body:
The reception staff, nurses and doctors are all very professional, helpful and reassuring. 
The building is clean and well organised. 
The car parking is awful.

title: Lovely friendly practice
body: Nice friendly staff, happy to help and always giving a warm welcome. Nice village practice. Parking and pharmacy

author: Exasperated member of staff
title: Pain clinic unavailable when I need them
body:
I have an open appointment with the pain clinic since injuring my back (bulging discs and trapped sciatic nerve) a few years ago. I am in acute pain right now and struggling to get comfortable to sleep or stay at work so decided to give them a call, only to find out the I can't get a telephone appointment for 8 weeks, not now when I need it. Right now I am struggling to stay at work but try my hardest not to go off sick. I actually work for the NHS and know how much of a drain on them it is when staff are off so push myself as much as I can but right now every day is a struggle.  
My own department have done everything they can to make things easier for me when at work, standing desk and suitable chair.  
I have previously had an injection into my spine, done in theatre, which got me back on my feet and had agreed to have a 2nd one, roughly a year later, when Covid hit and everything was cancelled. I called a year or so into Covid to so see if things had returned to normal but was told they still weren't doing injections. Since then I have had to carry on only taking meds.  
I am on morphine twice a day as well as a nerve inhibitor. My initial call to them was only to find out if the injections are now going ahead and to be put on their waiting list, but will have to wait the 8 weeks to find that out and then, if they agree and they are, will then have to then go on a waiting list, not knowing how long that will be, before it gets done. This all adds to the time that I am in pain and struggling to cope.  
I know every service is struggling to catch up with waiting times since Covid but a service like the pain clinic it vital to people like me when the pain gets too much and an 8 week wait until I even get to speak to someone I feel is just not great. When I have had to be seen in the past the care I have been given has been first class but actually getting to be seen when pain levels get to be unbearable is just impossible. This totally affects my quality of home and working life. It is having a detrimental affect on my quality of life and I feel like I am existing rather than living. I don't want to become another NHS Statistic and add to the list of staff off sick but don't see me being able to continue this way for much longer. Surely there is a better way of working than this !!!!!!
